alert.note: Alert for Curry; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 6:21AM MDT until May 26 at 7:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MDT THIS MORNING FOR CURRY AND NORTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT COUNTIES... At 621 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain moving east into the warned area once again this morning. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain fell overnight. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area from these new storms. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Melrose, Cannon Air Force Base, Ranchvale, Saint Vrain, Oasis State Park, Floyd, Portair and Pleasant Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 357 and 397. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
